item.title: By: Reb Yudel
item.dc:creator: Reb Yudel
item.description:
Note that the examples given of new heresies (Hermaphrotheism) are in fact traditional Jewish doctrines.
So too, a-essentialism-ism is the real deal. Essentialism is the heresy.

item.title: By: evanstonjew
item.dc:creator: evanstonjew
item.description:
They all are anti essentialist views, an idea at one time attached to nominalism and Duns Scotus and now associated with the mainstream of analytic philosophy. In European philosophy the free play of Derrida is sort of an analogue. I feel the theses are connected and form a larger whole, but you ask for a catchy name for just two.
I would suggest The Spectral Heresy denoting the view that things that were traditionally considered real are mere specters or virtual objects.

item.title: By: evanstonjew
item.dc:creator: evanstonjew
item.description:
The following views are considered heretical:
Judaism lacks an essence. There are just books and more books. Denominations creates a false depth.
Judaism lacks a religious or cultural center. Renewal can just as well come from anywhere and seep into Israel.
The Jews are a collection of unfriendly tribes at best, not a people or a nation.
Torah is open ended, with multiple underground tunnels burrowing to and from the outside world.
Holding on to God, Israel and the Torah is like holding onto air. Nothing will be ultimately left standing, only the endless desert, where it all started.
These heresies are a new shift towards a more radical anti- idolatry type monotheism, Wahabi style. Let’s call this heresy The New Apocalyptic Judaism.
You heard it here first. (You asked.LOL)
In this regard I want to recommend Reza Negastrani’s "Cyclonopedia." She is now.
